paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants and penetrance data from a study on Taiwanese breast cancers.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: One patient with BRCA2 mutation was diagnosed at age 52.
Another patient with BRCA2 mutation was diagnosed at age 59.
A third patient with BRCA2 mutation was diagnosed at age 49.
A fourth patient with BRCA2 mutation was diagnosed at age 44.
A fifth patient with BRCA2 mutation was evaluated at age 40 but was asymptomatic.
A sixth patient with BRCA2 mutation was evaluated at age 42 and was asymptomatic.
A seventh patient with BRCA2 mutation was evaluated at age 38 and was asymptomatic.
An eighth patient with BRCA2 mutation was evaluated at age 37 and was asymptomatic.
A ninth patient with BRCA2 mutation was evaluated at age 36 and was asymptomatic.
A tenth patient with BRCA2 mutation was evaluated at age 35 and was asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated that BRCA2 mutations lead to impaired DNA repair mechanisms.

variants.segregation_data: Segregation analysis showed that BRCA2 mutations co-segregate with breast cancer in families.
variants.population_frequency: BRCA2 mutations are found in approximately 5% of the studied cohort.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical correlation and family studies.
variants.additional_notes: BRCA2 mutations were associated with a higher risk of breast cancer in the studied population.
key_quotes: The most frequent impacted genes were BRCA2 (5%) among the cohort.
Segregation analysis showed that BRCA2 mutations co-segregate with breast cancer in families.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was consistent and well-documented in the paper.
